content: dress up a plain hat or upcycle an old one by crocheting a new hat band for it this pattern uses us terms for crochet and is a simple adjustable recipe made to the measurements of your hat this pattern is also good for stash busting the bands pictured here used handy hands lizbeth 20 cotton thread red white and blue nazli gelin garden 10 cotton thread black and white and dmc cebelia 10- all leftovers from other projects i used a 1 65mm hook for both bands as it s my favorite steel hook buttons were also from stash ingredients crochet thread size 10 or 20 - small fraction of a ball steel hook us size 7 1 65mm 1 button approximately the width of your band or use a bigger button if you re feeling fancy sewing needle with an eye large enough for your crochet thread choice getting an exact gauge is not terribly important you don t want to work too loosely or too tightly you ll want your band to have some drape but not be shapeless or gauzy or too stretchy you re aiming for a ribbon-like texture and consistency for reference with size 10 thread and 1 65mm hook at 8 double_crochet across my band was ¾ inch wide and used approximately 33 yards of thread
